data.title: dreamgirls
data.meta_description: DREAMGIRLS the play had come out when i was in high school and all thru out the years, i had the voice of jennifer holiday in my head and wondered how anyone could replace her... well, this came to fruition upon seeing the movie version of dreamgirls staring beyonce, eddie murphy, jamie foxx and…
data.text:
the play had come out when i was in high school and all thru out the years, i had the voice of jennifer holiday in my head and wondered how anyone could replace her...

well, this came to fruition upon seeing the movie version of dreamgirls staring beyonce, eddie murphy, jamie foxx and introducing jennifer hudson (late of american idol fame)...

we had missed the first few minutes, so we came in at the scene where the girls are singing at a talent show...being familiar w/the soundtrack - i was greatly surprized at the powerful vocal talents of jennifer hudson (playing the character EFFIE WHITE - based on the original Supreme florence ballard)doing the lead for move who has no problem stepping into the shoes of jennifer holday...

this movie was made for her...

while beyonce takes on the lead character, deena jones, she easily morphs into the role based on diana ross...and there is anika noni rose as lorrell robinson, based on the supreme member mary wilson...

the story follows an all female singing trio looking for their big break in the music business and they find, via curtis taylor, jr. (jamie foxx, in a role that ok, tho' he was no great shakes), cadillac dealer/up & coming record producer - he sees them, and likes what he hears...

he hires them to sing back up for eddie murphy (james "thunder" early) - who does all of his own singing, and i was so pleased to see him actually "acting" that i wasn't quite sure he could pull it off...

it's wonderful to know that this man has actual talent - away from those mind-candy comedies on which he has based his career...he delves deep into the rise and fall of and soul/r&b singer trying to make something better of himself and go for a different sound from whence he started...

thru out the film, i waited w/great anticipation for jennifer hudson to tackle the song, and i'm telling you, i'm not going made famous by another jennifer (holiday)...her rendition was simply incredible...she hit every note and then some...as i sat in packed theatre, people began to applaud her mid-song, and i got chills just listening to and feeling the pain in which she belted out the song...

as the movie continued on w/the letting go of effie and watching her struggle to survie w/her child (illegimate daughter), i found myself rooting for her and becoming less impressed w/beyonce...i like her, but i just wrap my brain around her acting skills...maybe it's me, i don't know - but i felt she was nothing to write home about..

on the other hand - eddie murphy completely surprized me...

all in all, i thought it a really wonderful movie...
